intro: Vanillosma obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leafed vanilla vine, is a climbing herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped, glossy leaves and fragrant, yellow-green flowers. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that contain the seeds used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential pharmaceutical applications.
